title: “Act of 2024” means the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous 

Provisions) Act 2024 (Part 3) (Commencement) Order 2024.

title: “Act of 2024” means the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024
heading: In this Order –
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order – 

“Act of 2005” means the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 
2005); 

“Act of 2024” means the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 
(No. 24 of 2024).
text_norm: 2 order - act 2005 mean social welfare consolidation act 2005 (no 26 2005) act 2024 mean social welfare (miscellaneous provisions) act 2024 (no 24 2024)

title: “Act of 2024” means the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024
heading: 3. The 1st day of October 2024 is appointed as the day on which the
text_raw:
3. The 1st day of October 2024 is appointed as the day on which the 

following provisions of the Act of 2024 shall come into operation: 

(a) 

section 13, in so far only as it effects the insertion of the following 
provisions of the Act of 2005: 

(i) 

subsections (1), (2) and (6) of section 68KC; 

(ii) 

subsection (2) of section 68KD; 

(iii) subsections (6) and (7) of section 68KE; 

(iv) subsections (5) and (12) of section 68KF; 

(b) 

section 14, in so far only as it relates to the amendments of section 
4 of the Act of 2005 specified in column (3) of the Schedule to 
the Act of 2024 opposite reference 1 of that Schedule. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 4th October, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4. The 31st day of March 2025 is appointed as the day on which Part 3 of 
the Act of 2024, in so far as it is not already in operation on that day, shall come 
into operation. 

[499] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 September, 2024. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Social Protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [499]

title: “Act of 2024” means the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order provides for the commencement of Part 3 of the Social Welfare 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024. 

Part 3 of the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024 amends the 
Social Welfare (Consolidation) Act 2005 to provide for a new Jobseeker’s PayRelated Benefit scheme. 

This Order provides that, apart from specified provisions of Section 13, Part 3 
shall commence from 31st March 2025. This is the date from which the 
Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit scheme shall come into effect. 
A number of specified provisions of Section 13 shall commence from 1st October
text_norm: explanatory note (this note part instrument purport legal interpretation.) order provides commencement part 3 social welfare (miscellaneous provisions) act 2024 part 3 social welfare (miscellaneous provisions) act 2024 amends social welfare (consolidation) act 2005 provide new jobseeker payrelated benefit scheme order provides apart specified provision section 13 part 3 shall commence 31st march 2025 date jobseeker pay-related benefit scheme shall come effect number specified provision section 13 shall commence 1st october

title: “Act of 2024” means the Social Welfare (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2024
heading: 2024. This will enable regulations that shall be made under these provisions to
text_raw:
2024. This will enable regulations that shall be made under these provisions to 
be laid before, and the approval by resolution sought of, the Houses of the 
Oireachtas, as required by Section 4(5) of the Social Welfare (Consolidation) 
Act 2005, in advance of the introduction of the Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit 
scheme. 

The new Jobseeker’s Pay-Related Benefit will be available to people who 
become fully unemployed on or after the date on which the scheme commences, 
who have a strong and recent attachment to the labour market, and who are 
available for and genuinely seeking employment. 

Key features of the new scheme include: 

The weekly rate of payment for people who have at least 5 years paid PRSI 
contributions will be set at 60% of previous earnings, subject to a maximum of 
€450 for the first 3 months. 

After that, the rate will reduce to 55% of earnings, subject to a maximum of €375 
for the following 3 months. 

A further 3 months will be paid at the rate of 50%, up to a maximum €300 
payment. 

For people who have between 2 and 5 years paid contributions, the rate will be 
set at 50% of previous earnings subject to a maximum for €300 per week and 6 
month’s duration. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [499] 5
